title: American Food by the Decades by Sherri Liberman
description:
In the United States today, how and what we eatÃ¢â‚¬â€with all of its myriad ethnic varieties and endless choicesÃ¢â‚¬â€is firmly entrenched in every part of our culture. 

The American diet underwent constant evolution throughout the 20th century, starting from the meat-and-potatoes fare of the early-20th century and maturing into a culture that embraced the cuisines of immigrant populations, fast-food chains, health fads, and emerging gourmet tastes. 

Societal changes moved women out of the kitchen and into the workforce, spawning the invention of convenience foods and time-saving kitchen appliances.

Genre: Non-Fiction, Cookery
